Welcome to **Space Exploration** - humanity's journey beyond Earth!

## What you'll learn:
- **Historic Missions** - Apollo, Voyager, and more
- **Telescopes** - Optical, radio, and space-based
- **Rockets & Propulsion** - How we reach space
- **ISS** - Living in space

> ðŸ’¡ **Fun Fact:** The first human in space, Yuri Gagarin, orbited Earth on April 12, 1961!

## The Space Age Timeline

| Year | Milestone |
|------|----------|
| 1957 | Sputnik 1 (first satellite) |
| 1961 | Yuri Gagarin (first human) |
| 1969 | Apollo 11 (Moon landing) |
| 1971 | First space station (Salyut 1) |
| 1981 | Space Shuttle first flight |
| 1990 | Hubble Space Telescope |
| 1998 | ISS construction begins |
| 2012 | Curiosity lands on Mars |
| 2021 | James Webb Space Telescope |

## Space Agencies

| Agency | Country |
|--------|--------|
| NASA | USA |
| ESA | Europe |
| JAXA | Japan |
| Roscosmos | Russia |

Let's explore how we reach the stars!

slides.title: Historic Space Missions
slides.content:
# Historic Space Missions ðŸŒ™

## Apollo Program (1961-1972)

The race to the Moon.

### Key Missions

| Mission | Achievement |
|---------|-------------|
| Apollo 8 | First to orbit Moon |
| Apollo 11 | First Moon landing (1969) |
| Apollo 13 | "Successful failure" |
| Apollo 17 | Last Moon mission |

**Apollo 11 Crew:**
- Neil Armstrong (Commander)
- Buzz Aldrin (Lunar Module Pilot)
- Michael Collins (Command Module Pilot)

> "That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind."

## Voyager Program (1977-present)

```
Voyager 1 and 2:
  Jupiter â†’ Saturn â†’ Uranus â†’ Neptune â†’ Interstellar space!
```

- Voyager 1: Farthest human-made object (~24 billion km)
- Golden Record: Message for aliens
- Still sending data!

## Mars Exploration

| Mission | Type | Year | Status |
|---------|------|------|--------|
| Viking 1,2 | Lander | 1976 | First soft landing |
| Spirit/Opportunity | Rover | 2004 | Opportunity: 14 years! |
| Curiosity | Rover | 2012 | Still active |
| Perseverance | Rover | 2021 | Seeking biosignatures |
| Ingenuity | Helicopter | 2021 | First powered flight |

## Other Notable Missions

- Cassini-Huygens (Saturn)
- New Horizons (Pluto)
- Juno (Jupiter)
- MESSENGER (Mercury)

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** 12 humans have walked on the Moon, all American!

slides.title: Telescopes
slides.content:
# Telescopes ðŸ”­

## Types of Telescopes

### Optical Telescopes

| Type | Design | Pros |
|------|--------|------|
| Refractor | Lenses | Sharp images |
| Reflector | Mirrors | Cheaper, larger |
| Catadioptric | Both | Compact |

### Radio Telescopes

- Detect radio waves from space
- Can work day or night, through clouds
- Must be HUGE (Arecibo: 305m)
- Example: ALMA, VLA

## Space-Based Telescopes

Why space? No atmosphere!

```
Ground:
  Starlight â†’ Turbulent atmosphere â†’ Blurry
  
Space:
  Starlight â†’ Crystal clear!
```

### Hubble Space Telescope (1990)

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Mirror | 2.4 m |
| Orbit | 540 km |
| Wavelengths | UV, visible, near-IR |
| Discoveries | Age of universe, dark energy |

### James Webb Space Telescope (2021)

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Mirror | 6.5 m (18 segments) |
| Location | L2 (1.5 million km) |
| Wavelengths | Infrared |
| Mission | First stars, exoplanets |

### Other Space Telescopes

- Chandra (X-ray)
- Spitzer (Infrared)
- Kepler/TESS (Exoplanets)
- Fermi (Gamma-ray)

> ðŸ’¡ **Key Point:** Different wavelengths reveal different phenomena!

## Life in Space

| Challenge | Solution |
|-----------|----------|
| Microgravity | Exercise 2+ hours/day |
| Oxygen | Electrolysis of water |
| Water | Recycled (including sweat, urine) |
| Food | Pre-packaged, some fresh |
| Sleep | Strapped in sleeping bags |

## ISS Science

- Microgravity experiments
- Human health studies
- Earth observation
- Materials science
- Biology and medicine

> ðŸ’¡ **Key Point:** The ISS has been continuously crewed since November 2000!
